name: omlop

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, coml), wcel(c0, cops), wcel(c0, col))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ OML, c0 ∈ OP, c0 ∈ OL)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, coml), wcel(c0, cops))
-| wi(wcel(c0, coml), wcel(c0, col))
-| wi(wcel(c0, col), wcel(c0, cops))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ OML → c0 ∈ OP)
⊣ (c0 ∈ OML → c0 ∈ OL)
⊣ (c0 ∈ OL → c0 ∈ OP)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, coml), wcel(c0, cops))
-| wi(wcel(c0, coml), wcel(c0, col))
-| wi(wcel(c0, col), wcel(c0, cops))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ OML → c0 ∈ OP)
⊣ (c0 ∈ OML → c0 ∈ OL)
⊣ (c0 ∈ OL → c0 ∈ OP)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, coml), wcel(c0, cops))
-| wi(wcel(c0, col), wcel(c0, cops))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ OML → c0 ∈ OP)
⊣ (c0 ∈ OL → c0 ∈ OP)

comment: An orthomodular lattice is an orthoposet. (Contributed by NM, 6-Nov-2011.)
